Reviews.Title: “One of the Nicest La Quintas”
Reviews.Author: jubes m
Reviews.Content: We almost always travel with out dog and almost always stay at La Quinta Inns because they are pet-friendly. This one is one of the nicest. We have stayed here before and will stay here again. This time we got one of the newer rooms, It was clean and very comfortable. The woman at the front desk was very friendly (I think she was the manager) and let me check in early - which was much appreciated after a long drive with little sleep the night before. - not to mention (and I did not) I would have had to have waited for several hours in my car with my dog. One of the other things I remember from staying at this motel in the past is that if you do not want maid service, they will put supplies like tp and towels in a bag on your door knob. We stayed only one night, this time, so I am not sure if they still do this, but regardless, I definitely recommend this La Quinta.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, gross bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Cathy R
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly and the room was fairly well maintained for such an old hotel. The problem arose when I went to shower this morning. The tub in our room needs desperately to be replaced. There are literally holes in the floor of the tub and the hard water stains gave it the appreance of having not been cleaned in quite a while. I will post a picture. I opted to wear my husband's flip-flops. I frequently stay in LaQuinta hotels and am generally very satisfied, but this one was not up to par. Judging by the other reviews, perhaps it was just our bathroom. I would recommend that staff not book rm. 129 until the tub is replaced.

Reviews.Title: “Oldie but Goodie”
Reviews.Author: canuckie_8
Reviews.Content: This motel is an older one that has been kept in really good shape. The rooms are clean, the beds comfortable. The room we were in had two beds and lots of room. We use 2 small dog cages and, even with them in the room, there was plenty of space. I am particularly fussy about bathroom cleanliness and this one is great, some repairs but really clean. The hallways are kept vacuumed. The pool has had repairs done to it and is kept clean and sparkly. The only negative with the pool is the handrail that goes into the water-it needs a good scrubbing. The staff are friendly and very helpful. The breakfast is the usual-waffles, a couple of types of cold cereal, instant oatmeal, bagels, muffins, toast, mixed fruit, orange juice and yogurt. It is a dog-friendly motel with no charge for the dog. The outside is well maintained, grass kept cut, gardens weeded, parking lot lit and clean. There is free wifi in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “good deal”
Reviews.Author: dwbtd
Reviews.Content: clean and pretty well maintained hotel - and great price if not a race week - staff was pleasant and even got us a frig for the room - only issue was breakfast did not start till 7 on a sunday and we had to get moving before then

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a La Quinta traveler
Reviews.Content: Overall a good hotel experience. The positives overshadowed the negatives. Friendly staff, accurate reservation, room well supplied and beds comfortable. There was a few small negatives such as the exterior key pads on several buildings malfuctioning most of the weekend, slow drain in tub and sink etc... There was a little problem with not being able to get near my car or take my dog to the dog walk area early Sat am because of the police searching for a stolen car/ thief but that is not the hotels fault.

Reviews.Title: “"Great"”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a La Quinta traveler
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay. Rooms very large with comfy beds. Staff very friendly, and breakfast was vey satisfying. Will be staying again when I come to visit my daughter at school.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a La Quinta traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to Daytona International Speedway and the airport. We heard planes taking off and landing, but they weren't very loud. The room & bathroom was very clean. The beds were comfortable. We enjoyed the pool and hot tub. The front desk clerks were friendly and helpful. The breakfast was good...usual items and they also offered waffles. The room we stayed in did not have a micro/frig. I don't know if any of the other rooms had them or if you could request a room with them. The location of the hotel was great...right off the interstate. There are lots of restaurant/fast food places close by. Overall, we liked this hotel and would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Race your way on over here to a Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Theresa T
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical at first at a price so good I was awaiting to behold the reasons why. Due to my tight budget yet love to travel and provide my son with an awesome summertime venture I managed to be able to afford something around the price range of 50 bucks a night. I read the reviews on The La Quinta Inn along with finding out their features, ammenities and location and right now we are currently enjoying our third day here. Super pleased with the room, the bed's bedding, pillows soo comfy they will transport you to relaxation to sleepy land as fast as a NASCAR can.go from 0 - 125 mph in 0-30 seconds! The room is pleasingly CLEAN!, the Inn's staff from the person at the front desk personal to the housekeeping and groundsmen extremely friendly and really nice to accomidate to your needs right away. The location is a little bit of a drive to the beach however you get to go by the Daytona Speedway, pass many shopping centers that house a fine selection of restraunts, fast food chains and department stores. I was tickled to see a dollar tree close by and YES we did stop and shop there. We did not have enough in our budget to dine out because if we did we would definetly be checking out the Wing House right next door that we keep smelling a delectable aroma and seeing a pretty full parking lot of diners there. Next time we come here we are so going to try it! We are currently I call it "Hotel Camping" Coolers with food & drinks for our stay. Though treated in the morning by going to Breakfast which The La Quinta provides a Belgium waffle maker that my son just absolutley gets thrilled for waking up early for lol and I share the same excitement with the coffee and selections of fruit, cereals, muffins shared in a sectioned off area off the side of the lobby that makes one feel like they are in a bed and breakfast. The pool here is good, hot tub came in handy to aid my aching muscles after a 23 hour drive from Jersey. A drive worth taking to stay on the Speedway, visit the Beaches and this hotel :) so close to excellence

Reviews.Title: “This hotel cares about your stay.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a La Quinta traveler
Reviews.Content: From the time you check-in until departure this hotel cares about your stay. Place was clean, quiet and priced right.

Reviews.Title: “Room At The Inn”
Reviews.Author: Margarita R
Reviews.Content: My nightmare started on the Friday of Daytona 500 weekend. We were on our way home from the Keys towing our new boat and as we exitted to I-95, our year old SUV lost power like it ran out of gas, but we had a third of a tank. We got off the highway and coasted down the ramp and that's where it died. It was 4:30 on Friday! Nobody could look at it til Saturday so I started calling for a hotel room. It was easier than I expected til I mentioned my little dog. By the time I called the La Quinta I was nearly in tears! The front desk personnel were a godsend. They calmed me down, gave me a nice, clean, comfortable room and a cookie for my dog! The location was great since I'm a NASCAR fan, so Saturday morning I walked to the track. Good wing restaurant directly next door too!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a La Quinta traveler
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpful staff and Manager. Beautiful grounds and great pool. I have stayed at this property about 10 times and it has always been a lot of fun John W

Reviews.Title: “a very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: jerry l
Reviews.Content: I recently enjoyed a very pleasant stay, at this hotel, during my recent visit to Daytona Beach. The spacious grounds were well kept and I enjoyed a walk around the property and admired the vast selectioin of trees,shrubs, and flowers. The room was well appointed, with plentynof nroom, and spotless. Breakfast offered a good selection of food, and the coffee was delicious. I found the staff to be friendly and ready to help. This was not my first stay here, and it won't be the last. Hat's off to Mike and his staff Jerry Paris Ontario Canada

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a La Quinta traveler
Reviews.Content: Our stay was nice. The breakfast bar was very busy but the lady working on it kept it up. She stayed busy the whole time and made sure everyone was getting what they wanted. I was very impressed with how she did her job. All the staff was very nice and considerate.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay near the Speedway”
Reviews.Author: mtnman6108
Reviews.Content: The room was large clean and comfortable. The linens were upscale, and the duvet comforter was a nice touch. The pillow top mattress was very comfortable. The interior rooms face a nicely landscaped courtyard and pool area. A perfect and peaceful place to walk your pet. Carpeting in the room, and hallways seemed new and climate control system worked well. Great value if you book in advance. Breakfast was adequate with bagels, muffins, juices, cereals, yogurt, and hot waffels.

Reviews.Title: “We Were Lucky To Find A Room!”
Reviews.Author: Zulinka
Reviews.Content: We were so lucky to find a room and it turned out to be very nice, clean and quiet. We didn't know it was Biker's Week! Would certainly stay at this Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: PralhadG
Reviews.Content: Stayed here just for a night on my way to Miami. Everything was in order. Staff was friendly with check-in and check-out. Room was clean. Breakfast was good. Only problem was that I could hear noises in my room, whenever anybody walked/talked in the hallway. Didn't hear anything from adjacent room, but everything from the hallway. I think they need to fix the doors. Not a problem if you are deep sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “I hate feeling ripped off!!”
Reviews.Author: Marion H
Reviews.Content: Due to unforseen circumstances, I was unable to make the the checkout deadline. For the extra time spent, I was charged for a full day. Of couse, no housekeeping or complimentary breakfast was needed. When I asked about the reason for a full charge, the managers only answer was "company policy". In my opinion the more obvious answer would have been "money grab". I will never go back.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: charles t
Reviews.Content: we recently stayed at la quinta Daytona with our small dog .I also was on crutches . Our room was ADA and cleaner than you could believe. There was no doggie odor , the bath was spotless and the bed was fantastic. Will definitely stay again when traveling from Pa to Fla or back.Staff was friendly and breakfast was great.

Reviews.Title: “Dog friendly”
Reviews.Author: sport_paws
Reviews.Content: Nice lookig pool outside, patios on all rooms- ours had antifreeze and beer cans on it. Comfortable beds, updated tv, vaulted ceilings made room seem huge. Would stay again for cheap price

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms, frienldy staff”
Reviews.Author: SBgirls
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this La Quinta. The room was good sized and the beds were comfortable. Front desk staff was very friendly. Conveniently located right off I-95. A little noisy, close to the airport - but it was only noticeable when outside - not inside the hotel. Big grassy area for pets. Well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Great Dog Friendly Location”
Reviews.Author: James A
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel based off a number of things including price, location, dog friendly, and reviews. It is close to the speedway, the beds were comfortable, new tv and looks like it was recently renovated. There was many other dogs there. The house keeping did start pretty early and kids running up and down the hallway on the second floor, other than that it was a good stay for the purpose.

Reviews.Title: “The room was very clean and VERY ORANGE...”
Reviews.Author: C F
Reviews.Content: HIGHS: price, room cleanliness, bed comfort, safety of interior hallways, large HD tv, VERY nice staff easy access to I-95 LOWS: awful room decor (VERY 70"s), no refrigerator in room VERDICT: A very good value with only a few minor trade-offs.

Reviews.Title: “Best location for I-95 & the Track”
Reviews.Author: Sdino
Reviews.Content: Good clean hotel right off I-95 & close to all restaurants & the Track. Staff were knowledgable about the area & assisted with directions & recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: Gopherhill
Reviews.Content: Stayed Thur, Fri Sat, nights - Old TV and reception is bad, esp. on HBO, shower small and curtain follows you, tub doesn't hold water, not weighted, Fri. night barking dog, door to room not closed by cleaning staff, but nothing missing, can't seem to stop "You have a message light." and no message, Sat. night, trash not emptied, coffee service not replenished, picked up my own supplies in lobby,

Reviews.Title: “The beds are the only thing going for this place”
Reviews.Author: reese1379
Reviews.Content: Breakfast didn't have a great selection. No eggs or sausage. Just waffles, bagels, toast, muffins, juice, coffee. The breakfast room was very small and cramped with people. We ended up leaving and getting breakfast somewhere else. The bathrooms were nasty with moldy tile/grout. The room was musty smelled. Someone also mentioned that in a previous review and they were right. It was damp inside. Our room was literally next to the exit doors and we heard everytime when someone went in and out it. It kept us up all night. We won't be staying here again. The only good thing was the bed. It was extremely comfortable. So, if you need somewhere to crash for the night, then this is your place. If you stay more then 1 night, I'd suggest you go somewhere cleaner.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny!!”
Reviews.Author: gvsuinnc
Reviews.Content: Came for the STS-134 shuttle launch. Best rate in the area which includes a continental breakfast with waffle makers. Very close to many attractions including 1h to Disney, 1h to Kennedy Space Center, 20m to beach, 20m to lighthouse, 1h to Fountain of Youth... and on and on. Great parking. Friendly service. Easy access to I-95. Lots of conveniences nearby. Outdoor pool. If we could improve anything, we'd sugget they clean the carpets - our daughter's feet were often dirty. Also, the breakfast area gets crowded so be sure to go early. Our door didn't latch unless we put full body force into it. The air conditioning worked well, but it got a bit musty in the room. Getting to the front desk for check-in appears tricky. It's basically a U-turn off International Speedway Blvd ... beyond The Wing House. We had a ton of teenagers and a few dogs here at the same time. No impact to our stay besides the crowded breakfast area and an occasional bark.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable place, looking forward to staying again.”
Reviews.Author: bryan75
Reviews.Content: We booked at La Quinta Inn Daytona Beach, 2725 International Speedway using its website. We were pleased with the appearance of the lobby area when we checked in. The room was very nice with two queen beds which were good for me and my two children. In particular, we enjoyed the breakfast. Waffle is their speciality. The staff were kind and friendly and the service was very good. The only comment we can make is the swimming pool was not maintained well. Overall, this is a quiet and cozy hotel. The surrounding area is kept clean and green. We really enjoyed our four day stay at this hotel. We have pleasant memories and would like to stay here once again when an opportunity arises.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Daytona Speedway”
Reviews.Author: 4theBirdsFlorida
Reviews.Content: Hotel and room was very clean and comfortable. Located 1 1/4 mile from Daytona Speedway. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I'm already impressed”
Reviews.Author: Flatcoatfun
Reviews.Content: I will be staying here in Feb 2011 so will give a complete review then - but I must say I am already impressed with the customer service. I spoke with Carlos at the front desk several times today making arrangements for a group. He actually took my phone number and called me back when he was taking care of a guest. I'm impressed. He gave our group a great rate and I'm looking forward to our stay.

Reviews.Title: “We will stay here over and over again.”
Reviews.Author: ORANGECELL
Reviews.Content: Visiting our son at ERAU for a week. We really enjoyed our stay here. As clean and comfortable as any 4 and 5 star hotels I have stayed in. While saving hundreds of dollars, our stay was under $50 a night. Breakfast every morning, fresh waffles and fruit. We sit outside and enjoy the weather and their landscaped grounds. We will continue to stay here whenever we visit our son. It is close to all shopping, restaurants, major roads, and ERAU. We stayed in some of the hotels directly on the beach. I still enjoyed our stay at this La Quinta.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Gopherhill
Reviews.Content: I was there in an individual room but a group of us used the hotel to attend a ministry event. The front desk was great and helpful. The room was clean. I was on the second floor and on the side away from the highway so it was very quiet. I really slept well. On the negative side I had to ask for toilet paper the first day, the shower head puts out a very poor spray, the TV needs to be replaced, and the small coffee service was not restocked. I had to ask for coffee packets. We were always out of the hotel before 6 AM so we didn't get to check out the free breakfast. There is a Wing House on the property.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly nice at a bargain price”
Reviews.Author: MarkandGeri
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights. Nice room. Outdoor pool and whirlpool. Our TV had a few problems, but it did not affect our ability to watch what we wanted. Great continental breakfast. Modern washer and dryer in laundry room; and they worked excellently. Grounds very well kept. Only issue is the fact that some rooms are a good walk from the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Racegrl03
Reviews.Content: I guess for the $55 a night price, it was not that bad. When we first got there, we were given a room that had a balcony but did not realize that the balconies on the first floor did not open up. So we were moved to another room where the shower head was a hand held and came up to my husband's waist. He is 6'4" and this was a handicap room which we did not ask for. We were then moved to a room on the 2nd floor where we could finally open the patio door. The rooms were ok but they smelled like something weird. When the room was cleaned, they made the bed but there was still trash everywhere, the trashcans were not emptied and they left no coffee for the next morning. Like I said, you get what you paid for. I think next time we are there, and we will have to travel there quite often in the next 4 years for my son's college experience, we will spend a bit more money to get a better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Roomy and comfy room with AMAZING!!!!!! pool and hot tub!!!!”
Reviews.Author: woo2go
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel coming back from The Keys. Had a fabulous room with paintings and cool designs on the sheets with a deck. The room was so roomy. There was like 3 feet between everything. High ceiling. The pool was the best pool I've ever been in ever in my life. I went in a 9:30 at night and it was 70 degrees and the pool was very warm. I never got cold once. The pool is surrounded by palm trees and the beautiful yellow hotel with spot lights. The water was crystal clear and nothing in it. The hot tub was great too. Also, manager if you are reading this. Give Tracy a bonus. She was the nicest staff member of a hotel I've been to in a long time. She was nice, knew all the answers, had a plunger for the clogged toilet, and talked with me like I knew her. So I would like to thank her for an even more pleasant stay. Thanks for great value and comfort!!

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for the $$$”
Reviews.Author: HappySC
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at this hotel. It is actually not bad, as long as you keep in mind that it is a $49 hotel in Daytona. The staff is friendly, polite, extremely helpful and pleasant. ' The breakfast area is very nice and they are not stingy with their offerings. The rooms are adequate. The down side? It's a bit too secluded and the parking lot is dark. Locks are iffy. You must double check your room door. I don't mind the bikers at all but I do mind some of the seedy characters hanging around, especially late at night. If I were traveling alone I would NOT stay here and I would NOT let my mother stay here. But with friends around, it is a good value and an excellt location.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad.. but spend the extra $ for a nicer place.”
Reviews.Author: TwoSleepyPups
Reviews.Content: We were sort of forced to pull over to this place because of torrential downpours on I-95. We have stayed at other La Quintas and figured this one wouldn't be so bad. It turns out, its really not that nice a place, even for a crap-hole motel.. good location, near food/gas/shopping/raceway/airport-- but like other reviews of the place, I must agree and feel inclined to share some details. First, the room wasn't as clean as I hoped it would be -- the pillow cases had mascara marks on them, random hairs everywhere and the shower flooded when on for more than a couple minutes (who knows what has been down that drain and now floating around my ankles?) Also, the "sliding doors" in the rooms -- the only windows-- were kind of sketchy and odd.. not a good view out the window obviously, but to me, a safety issue as well. Finally, the hallway IS creepy, dark, and hollow, so don't expect to have a quiet night, especially with Biker neighbors or Spring Breakers. All in all, I would probably scrounge the extra 10 bucks or so and stay at a nicer place.

Reviews.Title: “Plesant surprise”
Reviews.Author: lbcarroll
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel last minute when we found we would be arriving a day ahead of our original schedule. The rate was rather high but It happened to be race week so not many last minue rooms available. The hotel was right off the exit. Staff was wonderful and room was clean! We will stay again if the need arises!

Reviews.Title: “Should be shut down”
Reviews.Author: RoadyMom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to this hotel in March of 08 because our son lives in Daytona Beach and we came up from South Florida for his birthday. We like the LaQunita Inns because we travel with our service dog, but they are dog friendly and it makes life a lot easier. We pulled up to the hotel at about 10p.m. It was dark, with no security and next to a biker bar. The hotel clerk was rude beyond belief. When we asked for help with our bags he said "I ain't no bag boy". Our room was in a deserted part of the hotel with many rooms unlocked. A youth group was staying at the hotel and the kids were using these unlocked rooms for some "quiet time together". Our room was beyond dirty. It smelled like smoke. Everything was covered in grease. The toilet had not been cleaned in a very long time. There were signs of recent use in the toilet. We tried to spend the night, but it was so bad, that at mid-night we called another La Quinta Inn in Daytona Beach who made a room available for us. I must admit, when I called the corporate office the following Monday, they were very helpful and nice. Gave us a gift card for a free night. We still stay at La Qunita's but never that one again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room, Slow Internet”
Reviews.Author: 1NicePerson
Reviews.Content: Agree with previous reviewer. Rooms are very nice but internet signal is dismal. If you're looking for "high speed" internet access, look elsewhere. Otherwise, I was quite pleased with the hotel. It's right off I-95 so very convenient for travelers. The price can't be beat either.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Internet Service”
Reviews.Author: charlebd2003
Reviews.Content: I had reserved and booked a room with a condition that internet be provided as it is advertaised in the Website. I arrived and enquired if inernet was working as I was on travel status and had a mountain of documentation to be done. Got in the room which was very impressive and clean. Booted up the computer just o see that the connection was very low, went to front desk and the staff (EJ) said he would have someone from the computer technical suppor call me for set-up. Well I was on the phone with this individual for over 30 min.. The system increased from a very low signal to low, however it was taking a eternity to open sites and I was terrified that I would lose my work. The individual said that it was possible cause I was located by stairs, asked if I should move and he indicated that I might not get better service. Had no choice byt the cancel my reservation and EJ at the front office was very kind and professinal and offered to find me accomodation at the Quinta on Port Orange. He took the time to contact them to ensure that their internet worked and got ma a reservation there. He was real helpfull and professional althought it cost be $25.00 more. I love this Quinta on Port Orange and would stay here again. No fault to EJ he was such a professional and kind and very apologetic in dealing with me. Bouquet of FLowers to EJ.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but terrible and rude service from management”
Reviews.Author: SB09Guest
Reviews.Content: For a spring break trip, the La Quinta in Daytona Florida is a nice location for fun and privacy, but if you are a college student expect to get hassled by the management. Additional charges, false promises, and daily threats of being kicked out with no refund by Kieret(?), the manager, are a normal occurrence. His staff, who supposedly only gets $3 dollars per room to clean, complains about him to the guests, which provides a little humor on the day. So all though the price is very appealing and the location seems nice, just be prepared to have to spend a few minutes a day being threatened by upper management.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: SillieFillie
Reviews.Content: We stubled upon this hotel quite by accident while driving from NY to Florida.. We had not planned to stop in Daytona, but due to terrible traffic in Georgia (I95 is one big contraction zone in the state of GA....then there was a terrible accident outside of Savannah) our schedule went entirely out the window. We found ourselves entirely exhausted and in great need of a good night's sleep befoe continuing on. We were traveling with a small dog so our choices were limited. We found La Quinta listed in a "Florida Traveler" coupon book, advertised rate of $49 per night. Called the property, found they had a room available and one hour later we checked in with our dog. Didn't expect much, due to the price, and only a two diamond rating from AAA. What a surprise!!! The hotel looks like an old motel from the outside, but inside.....Lovely. Comepletey renovated rooms, very large, everything new.......carpets, bathrooms etc. New LG flat screen TV's, very comfortable bed, new and very clean linens. In room movies. The room looked like a Hilton Garden or Hampton Inn, at 1/3 the priceThe staff was very friendly and helpful. We got a room for 49 per night and they only charge a $10 pet fee, It is obvious they are trying hard with their upgrading and renovations, as well as their cleanliness. Would defintely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A very good experience”
Reviews.Author: MLM-Jeweler
Reviews.Content: We had several pleasant surprises during our 4-1/2 day stay at this hotel. Before I talk about that, however, let me just briefly mention that the reviewers who were angry that there was no "ocean view" might want to make a note - it's the LaQuinta at the beach that has the ocean view, NOT the one in Daytona proper near I-95. The addresses are completely different, so if you're looking for that ocean view, be sure to book the correct LaQuinta. At any rate, we were pleasantly surprised on several levels, especially after reading some of the reviews. First, regarding noise. We could hear the occasional commercial jet roar overhead, but other than that we were pleased at how quiet our room turned out to be. Also, we were on the side of the hotel closest to the race track, and there were 24-7 tests going on. We would step outside and be blasted by the noise, but inside our room, even quiet conversation eliminated the rest of the noise. Second surprise? The beds. They were firm, comfortable, and outfitted with clean linens. (In fact, there were so many blankets, comforters, etc. I think we would have been warm in Alaska! Third surprise? The bathroom linens. For the very low price we were paying, I expected tiny towels, worn transparent. Instead, they were large (not huge, but definitely adequate) and in great shape. Cleanliness? Everything in our room was clean. I'm one of those people who would have pitched a royal fit if there had been a dirty bathroom. The public areas were also very clean. The staff? Terrific at all levels, regardless of age, ethnic origin, or gender. All were helpful and cooperative. Downsides? Only a couple. If you MUST have a minibar and a microwave in your room, then this is not your hotel. Neither are provided. However, for the price, we didn't much care! On a final note - we were traveling with two very timid cats. The staff was especially understanding about their needs.

Reviews.Title: “Not so clean and noisy”
Reviews.Author: left4tx
Reviews.Content: We checked in a couple of hours ago and weren't told that the ice cream truck parked outside of our room would be running all night long. We can hear it rumbling about 10 feet from our window. It's now close to 11 pm and were told we can move to another room but instead elected to stay in this one since we are unpacked and dressed for bed and very tired from a long day of travel. There is no hot water. We asked the front desk about that too and didn't even get an answer. The room is not filthy but not clean enough that I would recommend it for families with children. Hallway is creepy. There is a dirty q-tip on the floor about 3 feet from our door and someone is sitting on the floor leaning against another door room about 5 doors down. Can't wait to leave in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: Ann778096
Reviews.Content: We stayed here several days while our first year college student moved into his dorm/attended orientation at a local University; The hotel is very pet friendly; the staff were responsive to our needs; the room was spacious with two doulble beds, one lounge chair and a desk/chair; the wireless internet worked but not seemlessly; it was quiet despite being close to the airport; the pool was pleasant with new furniture although the deck and pool itself was cracked; the breakfast was basic juice toast, frozen toaster waffles and bagels (that ran out)), only two cereal selections. The room abnd hotel were clean. There is easy access (by car) to many restaurants and all manner of shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Race time stay-not vacation stay, makes a difference”
Reviews.Author: MarineCorpsParents
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Daytona for the race and it was a 15 min walk to the race way. Lots of places to eat w/in walking distance. The Inn had free hot dogs, hamburgers, drinks, chips, beer the day of the race. Staff extremely nice. Place was clean, its an older place. We would stay again. Price wasn't bad and there was A/C. Normally we drive over for day and drive home after the race as we live in Tampa Bay. For vacation, you pay for what you get, this is not a resort...but if you want to pay less in order to do more this is the place to stay. We hope to stay here again for next race time. Beach was a 10 minute ride max...

Reviews.Title: “Barely ok for the price”
Reviews.Author: mommymarsha
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to stay overnight with a dog and this was very convenient off I-95. The girl at the front desk was friendly and efficient. The hallway smelled very bad. The room also had a kind of moldy smell. The sink in the bathroom was mostly clogged. The bed was quite comfortable. We were happy to see an ice cream machine! The drink machine did not work though. We went to breakfast at 8:40 (it's over at 9:00) and there was nothing but 1 bagel left.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a lot of work”
Reviews.Author: fabthunder
Reviews.Content: The only positives were the price and location. Otherwise, the place is filthy, our balcony obviously had not been cleaned in weeks, cig butts everywhere, very old bird's nest on the a/c unit. No furniture on the balconies either, not that you would have wanted to sit outside. Staff didn't seem to care. We asked numerous times for cleaning and no one showed. It took 3 calls to get the bathroom light replaced. How did the maid clean the bathroom without any light??? Would never stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Everynody was trying hard to make this place nice......................”
Reviews.Author: Impala guy
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night last week. Its an older property, but they are working hard to improve it and make it look nice. Looked like business was good as the parking lot was pretty full the next morning. Our room was OK and everything worked as necessary. Breakfast was Ok in the morning and we could see that improvements are being made, even now. Everyone was friendly to us and the entire place seemed safe and we got a good nights sleep. It is right off the Xway, kinda close to the raceway but NOT close to the beach. Just keep un mind that this is not a four star motel but a decent place to spend the night and get a morning breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Needs maintenance”
Reviews.Author: stirred
Reviews.Content: Good points: friendly staff, hotel is nearby the interstate and easy to get to. Bad points: the toilet ran all night, the bathtub was clogged and I was up to my ankles in water by the end of my shower, and the room smelled like urine after a while because of the toilet running. Also, there was no trash can in the room. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Moldy but bearable...”
Reviews.Author: TopherB
Reviews.Content: I have had good experiences in La Quintas in other locations. This experience had a ominous start in that when I first arrived an irate customer who claimed he had been trying to get his room cleaned for three days was screaming into the office phone working his way up the food chain from assistant manager to manager to corporate manager, and no one was helping him. This tied the clerk up for about 10 minutes before she turned to me, finally letting him rant unassisted into the phone. After that check in was effecient and friendly. The hallway was kind of dingy, but sparkling compared to the room. When I'm tired and getting a coupon rate I'm not too picky as long as the air conditioner works which this one did in spades. But beyond that it was not pleasant.: 1) The fan in the bathroom did not work and the smell in their was rank. 2) The door closed so that it appeared closed but did not actually latch (not a big deal as I always check those things) 3) The patio door was almost impossible to open and close. 4) But the big thing was the mold. Now I've come to expect mold in low cost motels in Florida, but this was above and beyond. The picture on the wall was mold encrusted. The last two feet of carpet before the patio door was pure white (it's a blue-gray carpet). I so wish I had my digital camera with me. The ceiling, especially by the main door, was pocked with mold. Almost comically the complimentary Travelhost magazine ended June 2006. I left it out and the maid nicely returned it to it's drawer. On the plus side, the high speed internet offered both wireless and plug in options and was flawless. The room key was programmed correctly the first time (a rarer and rarer occurence for me) The pool and jacuzzi and area were surprisingly clean and nice, although a hotter jacuzzi would have been nice, but that's me. All in all I'll pop a few extra bucks for a nicer place next time through.

Reviews.Title: “La Crappy”
Reviews.Author: vakmom
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not on the ocean. It is on interstate 95. I don't understand what these people are talking about "with an ocean view". The room was dirty and mold was everywhere. Not just all over the bathroom, but also on the walls in the room itself. This was a very disappointing La Quinta.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a stop over”
Reviews.Author: mgk1951
Reviews.Content: My husband and I needed a place to stay along I-95 while driving from South Florida to NY. We have a dog and needed a place that accepted pets. We found the motel to be clean and the grounds were adequately maintained. The front desk staff was very friendly. Our room king bed room was large and had a refrigerator. The bathroom was very clean. The free breakfast was defintely adequate to get us going in the morning (bagels, muffins, cereals, juice, coffee, etc). The local newspaper was free. We got a great price through AARP and an even cheaper rate with a coupon on our return trip. The motel definitely met our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel if you are in a budget”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my wife while we were in bussiness at Daytona for 8 nights. First we got a terrific rate at $42.00 the night. The hotel room was clean, the beds were acceptable and the bathroom was always clean. The only thing was that the water pressure in the shower was not great, but hey that was no biggie. The hotel grounds were clean and well kept. The staff was always friendly and the continetal breakfast was ok. I recomend this hotel if, like me, you are in a tight budget. I have stayed at a lot of hotels like this and I can assure you this is one of the best in its class. Remember this is not the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel? My Foot!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i went to this "hotel" if thats what passes for a hotel these days... and i was utterly and overly digusted. these people charged us for two nights when we showed up on one day at 5 in the morning and wanted to stay until 5 the next morning. alas it was not to be so. furthermore, their hotel had roaches, the shower had no curtains, the beds were uncomfortable, the so called complimentary continental breakfast was a deep imbelishment and was mor eof a CON-tinental, as in prison food! further more the vending machine stole my money, and, my car was spat on by some miscreant! i am utterly repulsed by this hotel, and i advise nobody to ever venture there ever!!! TRUST ME ON THIS...

Reviews.Title: “Clean but Creepy”
Reviews.Author: ktripping
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on TripAdvisor I thought this would be a good place to stay, but after looking at the hotel grounds and the room and the people hanging out around the hotel, I quickly cancelled my reservation and moved to another hotel in the area. I don't know if La Quinta on Speedway Blvd could even qualify as a "hotel" as it has a definite "motel" atmosphere. The room, a king with fridge, was large but was also on ground floor. There was only a dead-bolt for the entrance door (no safety latch) and I did not like patio door that had alot of give, despite a "safety rod". When I brought this up to the Front Desk Manager she assured me there was security that patroled the grounds. However I insisted I did not feel safe. Luckily I was able to cancel my reservation with no charge and I didn't have to argue with the front desk. It may be an "okay" place to stay for some, but not for business travelers or families.

Reviews.Title: “Really good value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Clean, spacious rooms. Curtious service. I definately recommend this hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: La Quinta Inn Daytona Beach/International Speedway
HotelInfo.Address: 2725 International Speedway, Daytona Beach, FL 32114
